definitions.text: absence of moral or spiritual values

examples: he moved off into the darkness

definitions.text: the time after sunset and before sunrise while it is dark outside

examples: he was in the dark concerning their intentions

definitions.text: devoid of or deficient in light or brightness; shadowed or black
examples: dark as the inside of a black cat

definitions.text: (used of color) having a dark hue
examples: dark colors like wine red or navy blue

definitions.text: brunet (used of hair or skin or eyes)
stemming from evil characteristics or forces; wicked or dishonorable; ; ; ; ; ; ; -Thomas Hardy
examples: his black heart has concocted yet another black deed
Darth Vader of the dark side
the scheme of some sinister intelligence bent on punishing him

definitions.text: showing a brooding ill humor; ; ; ; ; ; - Bruce Bliven
examples: the proverbially dour New England Puritan
a saturnine, almost misanthropic young genius

definitions.text: lacking enlightenment or knowledge or culture
examples: benighted ages of barbarism and superstition
a dark age in the history of education

definitions.text: marked by difficulty of style or expression
examples: much that was dark is now quite clear to me
those who do not appreciate Kafka's work say his style is obscure
the dark days of the war
a week of rainy depressing weather
the first dismal dispiriting days of November

definitions.text: having skin rich in melanin pigments
examples: National Association for the Advancement of Colored People
the theater is dark on Mondays
